title: Treasury League - Advisor Election
body:
### Summary

Governance opened Advisors positions for finance, accounting, business development, ecosystem development, token economy, DAO architecture and facilitation, and collected applications over 2 weeks.

With this poll, the community is called to select candidates who will join current members for the next Treasury League mandate.

### Details
[This post](https://gov.idle.finance/t/job-treasury-league-v2-0-open-applications/590) collects applications submitted between Aug 10th and Aug 24th and reports info about areas of responsibility and compensations.

[**If you need additional information, read the Leagues feedback on candidates before submitting your vote**](https://gov.idle.finance/t/job-treasury-league-v2-0-open-applications/590/17).

Candidates:
@thomas - Advisor for Token economy and DAO architecture and facilitation: [Application post](https://gov.idle.finance/t/job-treasury-league-v2-0-open-applications/590/8)   
@Felix - Advisor for Token economy, DAO architecture and facilitation, and Ecosystem Development: [Application post](https://gov.idle.finance/t/job-treasury-league-v2-0-open-applications/590/9)

There are no minimum or maximum open positions.
The minimum voting threshold for a candidate to be elected is 10’000 IDLE votes. 

This Temperature Check complies with the [stkIDLE Voting Framework](https://gov.idle.finance/t/voting-framework-for-stkidle-holders/567). 

This poll is available for both [$IDLE token holders](https://snapshot.org/#/idlefinance.eth) and [stkIDLE holders](https://snapshot.org/#/staking.idlefinance.eth).

The final $IDLE voting weights will be calculated using the [approved calculator](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BnH9boRmBADuyquvDMh0AmQfF97Zj76sIENKtySLU8o/edit?usp=sharing) 


### Vote options

* Elect @thomas
* Elect @Felix
* None of the above

For this election we are using Snapshot with the “Weighted voting” strategy, allowing voters to distribute their voting weight across different options. Please note that *it's possible to change the votes anytime*, until the voting window is closed.
